description:
Questions that burn under the nails of each and every leftist: What did Marx mean by fetishism? Who was Rubinstein - Freud's pet name for his beloved, a pendulum often used in hypnotherapy, or rather a Soviet psychologist? Did the localists in the 19th century labor movement want their own independent party locality, was it about local autonomy or was it after all about a local united front?
With 62 question cards including answers, the time between demonstrations can be passed in no time and people will have fun doing it. Every shared flat will be able to collectively raise itself to a high level of knowledge. Suitable also for the beginning of studies and as a source of nasty questions for/to the professor or student.

—description from the publisher

In this game you are confronted with questions about leftist theory. Play Radical Pursuit cooperative and correctly solve the question as collective or do it in a competitive mode, collecting as much of your correctly answered questions that no one else could answer to win the game. In competitive mode you sure could also team up... it's up to you, what you make out of this game!

Revive the art of storytelling using these nine beautifully illustrated wooden dice to create ghostly stories.

Construct your own spooky adventure tale with an array of creepy characters such as vampires, headless horsemen and decapitated knights. You can use your cloak of invisibility to escape from the dungeon in the haunted house, but beware of the creaking staircase! Once you’ve made it out, will your getaway car break down in the spooky forest under a full moon…?

This is the perfect family game that will stimulate the imaginations of children and adults alike. Ideal for playing by a log fire. But beware: this box glows in the dark!

Collectible Football (Soccer) game with comic style animal teams.

Can be played on any even underground (i.e. table or smooth floor) or on the Football field mat included in the main package.

The figures were included in the known „Kinder Überraschung“ („Kinder Surprise“). These chocolate eggs were very popular in Germany and other countries.

They alway had a yellow capsula inside, which contained some small toy - about 1/7 to a certain campaign theme, like Asterix, the Smurfs or - in 2006 - before the Football World championship in Germany: Comic animal footballers with a magnetic bade.

They could be used to „push“ around the metall „football“ to score goals,

There were 5 teams (Yellow / Red / White / Blue / Green) and some accesories to be collected. Each complete Team had 1 goal keeper and 2 field players. But even with only 2 players one could have a little soccer game on any table etc

This is a game about the German city of Ratingen, and was likely part of a radio promotion (Radio Neandertal UKW 97.6).

The board is divided into districts.  Players place tiles representing a different industry (service, trade, hospitality, leisure, residential) into matching districts and score points based on which where it was played and how many other tiles had been played there.  There are also three, black-bordered wild plots that can be from any industry.  The game comes with 60 tiles and show actual companies and organizations from Ratingen ... or at least were in Ratingen in 1998.

To begin the game, the tiles are shuffled and placed face down in a general supply.  Each player draws 6 tiles and places them face up in front of them.

On each turn, the following may happen:


     Exchange: The active player may give two tiles to another player and take one of their tiles.  This cannot be refused.
     Place Tiles: The player may place as many tiles as they want onto empty plots in one district.  Tiles much match the plots by color.  The player then scores points according to what is printed on the board for that district and the number of tiles placed there.
     Draw Tiles: The player draws 0-3 tiles from the supply.  This number must be announced before the first tile is drawn.


Each action is optional, but they must be performed in the above order.

The game ends when all plots have been filled, or if one player has placed 5 sets of tiles on the board (i.e. placed tiles on 5 separate occasions during the game).  If that happens, all other players get one more turn each.  Each remaining unplayed tile is -5 points for the player holding them, and then whoever has the highest score wins.

—user summary

Light a spark of randomness in
your game nights and creations!

Dec-Kreative is a deck of cards full of randomized prompts to help any kind of creative people!
Every card also contains additional, funny rules that you can apply when you play board games or RPGs!
Will you be willing to pay the penance? ?

An exaggeration of prompts!
Every Dec-Kreative card contains:


     A complete set of dice with random values (D10, D100, D4, D6, D8, D12, D20).
     An alphabet letter.
     An hour of the day, counter or clockwise.
     A weather symbol.
     An emotion with a moral alignment.
     A target on a humanoid dummy.
     A class/job.


Plus, a system to make teams from 2 to 10 people, grouping them for:


     On/Off; Black/White.
     Rock, Paper, Scissors.
     Card suits / Elements / Seasons.
     Fingers of the hand / Senses / Zener cards.
     Chess pieces.
     Musical notes / days of the week / Deadly Sins.
     The Winds.
     The Muses.
     The Commitments.


All these elements can be used also as randomic prompts.

Furthermore:

     Additional rule to apply to the game in progress.
     Penance to pay if mistaken.
     First player and tie-breaker method.


When you are stuck, pick a card and let imagination flow!

Ancient Terrible Things: Reawakened is a pulp-horror tabletop game for 1-4 players.
You play the role of an intrepid and foolish adventurer exploring a dark jungle river for Secrets. 
Each turn you must travel to a Fateful Location and face an Ominous Encounter. 
If you overcome the Encounter (using a combination of dice, tokens and cards) you gain Secrets. 
The object of the game is to be the player with the most Secrets when the game ends at the Inexplicable Event.

Game play involves rolling dice to achieve combinations: runs, pairs, three or more of a kind, and single die showing a particular number or higher. Dice combinations are spent to overcome Encounters and to acquire the four resources used in the game: Focus, Mystery, Treasure and Feat tokens.


     Focus tokens are used to activate Swag cards to better manipulate dice results.
     Mystery tokens are spent to overcome any Encounter when visiting the Yawning Chasm.
     Treasure tokens are spent to purchase useful Swag cards from the Trading Post which give you a permanent game effect.
     Feat tokens are spent to play one-shot Feat cards from your hand.


Ancient Terrible Things: Reawakened is the third implementation of the Dicequest game system as previously used in Ancient Terrible Things (1st/2nd Edition) and Konja.
The third edition incorporates edited and revised content from all previous iterations and expansions of the game, renovated art and language-independent graphic design into a new and definitive edition of ATT.

—description from the publisher

How well do you know your history? The ghastly-fun but educational Horrible Histories Board Game will have players frantically racing through history!

Move from the Awful Ancients to the Measly Middle Ages, through the Terrible Tudors and the Vile Victorians to the modern times by answering “Horrible” multiple-choice questions, acting out charades and trying to avoid Rattus and his tricky “Chance” cards!

Based on the award-winning Horrible Histories series, this family fun, educational board game encourages learning through play and is perfect for 2-4 players age 8 years and over.

As you race to the finishing line your knowledge of history will help you move faster and win.

Each player receives the same complete set of colorful tangram pieces. 30 playing cards contain laying tasks, the figures, mixed from the correct colors and black parts.
One card is turned face up and the player who first correctly laid the figure receives this card. After that, the next cards are played. The player who has collected the most cards wins.

Note: The game Tangram Race is designed similarly, with the difference that there are no colors given in the pieces to be laid.

—user summary

Play with family Wutz and Peppa Pig. Move around the playground and buy places from Peppa's world! As soon as one player runs out of money, the others count their banknotes. The player with the most money wins.

—user summary

The players start at the "Sporthilfe" space. Movement is determined by a die. If a meeple gets on a sports space, he puts the corresponding athlete card on that space.

If a meeple gets on a space with an athlete card he has to compete for a bronze medal by playing condition cards. The winner places his athlete card and the bronze medal on the space. The next competition on this space is for the silver medal and the loser gets the bronze medal. The third competition on a sports space finally is for the gold medal.

If a meeple gets on a space with a medal, the owner gets points awarded.

On a space "Trainings-camp" the player gets to draw a new condition card.

When all gold medals are awarded, the player with the most medals wins the game.

—user summary

Hexagonal version of Lines of Action.

Player move their pieces according to the number of total pieces  in the "line of action"

Objective is to consolidate all your own pieces in a connected group.

In the social deduction game Dune: Betrayal, players take on the identity of one of the iconic characters of Dune, each representing a distinct role within the factions vying for control amid the sands of Dune.

Your goal is to learn the identities of your foes while protecting your nobles, forming alliances, and utilizing tools to gain knowledge, and therefore power. Pay close attention to determine your allies and enemies, then defend your allies and attack your foes to secure victory.

—description from publisher

Zombies are taking over your town... it's time to start shooting! (with rubber bands, that is).

Players set up zombie meeples in their player colors in and around chipboard buildings, then take turns trying to shoot down opposing zombies with rubber bands. Score points for opposing ones, but be careful not to knock over your own in the process!

Dear Detective, You're obviously aware of the unsolved murder of David Cuthbertson.

As his prodigy and one of the top detectives in the country, I do hope you will be able to crack it. His body was discovered by a dog walker in Chromaville at 6am on Saturday 14th March 2020. I can send you all the information I have gathered surrounding the case.

David appears to have been conducting cases of his own and was found with an interesting array of paperwork on his person. I will also include this to help you with your investigation. Any help you can give me in solving this case would be greatly appreciated.

Try your hand at this tricky murder mystery ‘whodunnit’ and solve the case of David Cuthbertson. Expect 2-3 hours of mind boggling twists and turns as you unveil the truth behind this awful crime... great for a couple of budding detectives, or as a gift for the inspector in your life.

Magic Sword Tactics is a tower defense game for solo play.

Use the power of the magic sword to fight against the Demon King's army that is attacking the city.
The game is cleared when you defeat the Demon King before he destroys the city.

Roll the 10-sided die to inflict the damage set for each demon sword.

Build a better deck of swords to fight the Demon King's army!

Art Smart  is an art auction game for 3-5 players in which all players buy and sell art – but watch out for fake pieces.

Depending on the number of players each player gets dealt a number of Painting cards and an equal number of Fake/Real cards.

Every round of the game is an auction where a Painting card gets auctioned off in which the auctioneer participates as well. After the painting is sold and the money is handed over, it's established if the painting was Real or Fake and the Artist's value goes up or down.

After all Paintings are auctioned the game ends and the player who owns the combined highest value of Paintings wins.

—description from the designer

Statistical game to replay all JUDO Olympic Tournaments of History.
Very quick play.
Single fight resolved by two rolls of 3 six dice.
Very realistic results but some surprises may occur like in real sport.

Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number, or word to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit.

—user summary

Where the wild chicken gang appears, it goes around: All players put a playing card on their head and off they go! The players try to place matching wild chickens cards in pairs. But watch out, if the card falls off the head, it's "chicken overboard". The winner is always the one who is the fastest. When you discard cards, you win all the cards that are on the pile with the cards that have already been revealed. When shouting "chicken overboard", you only win the card that has fallen down or that is not right.

—user summary

Pictures must be placed in a chain as long as possible. To do this, the other players must accept an association with a free category and the current card. You draw and show a card and name an association; in teams, the association named first is valid. If the association is not accepted or if there is no free space, the card is discarded and a new one is drawn. Another team/player can take this card and use it for a free category, it scores 2 points after time expires; the active team scores 1 point per card in the longest chain. The first to reach 25 points wins.

—user summary

The Mirroring of Mary King is a two-player game in which one person is a mortal contemporary woman named Mary King and the other player is the ghost of Mary’s long dead ancestor, a 17th century Scottish merchant burgess of the same name. While on a week’s holiday in Edinburgh, Mary visits Mary King’s Close where her presence attracts the spirit of her long dead ancestor, now a hungry ghost that wants to live again in Mary’s body. The two Marys engage in a battle for control of the living Mary’s mortal body.

Players use control cards and power cards to exert their influence on Mary King’s psyche, represented by 12 tiles arranged in a 4 x 3 grid. These tiles are flipped back and forth throughout the game as the players gain and lose control of them.

The game progresses over five days, starting on Monday and ending on Friday. Each player gets one turn each day, with the ghost player always going first. As the week progresses, the mortal and the ghost become more exhausted and more desperate: the number of control cards each may play decreases and the number of ideas they may pursue increases. At the end of each player’s turn, both players suffer penalties based on the tiles of Mary that their opponent controls.

A player may immediately win the game by completing their image of Mary using the 12 tiles, or if their opponent runs out of cards. If neither player completes their image of Mary by the end of Friday, the winner is determined by a scoring system based on their remaining cards and their control of Mary.

—description from the publisher

Boardgame following basic rules and theme of the Card Game Kleine Fische.

25 randomly drawn cards, which are either fish cards or cave cards, are laid out face down on a game board. The aim of the game is for the players to score the most points by collecting fish and treasure.
The players diving through the sea, starting from the boat adjacent to the playing field, which can be moved as first step. The diver (players figure)can always move to neighbouring fields, but must keep to the swimming direction. As soon as the diver reaches a fish card, he uncovers it and decides whether to stop or continue swimming.
If he continues to swim, the next fish card must be turned over. You have to stop your turn as soon as a fish type is revealed twice. You then lose both of this type.
There are also caves to be explored. You need to uncovered as many fish as the number on the cave card indicates, before exploring it. If this is successful, the diver receives the advantage of the cave card.
As soon as you end (freely or forced to), the 2nd phase is carried out. In this phase, the octopus is moved depending on the number of octopus symbols on the revealed fish cards. As soon as the octopus lands on a field with a diver, it tries to steal a fish from the diver. This is done like in the origiginal card game by a setting a number of cards and rolling a dice from the active player. In case of success (equal or higher the number) the octopus robes this number of cards for the active player. With a -1 he loses 1 card, which he has to give to the robbed player.

The active player now gets all cards which are open.
The places are refilled from a stack. The game ends when this is not possible for all empty fields.
From the fish cards only the highest card from each fish type counts. The points from the treasure cards and from the fish cards are added. 
The player with the highest points wins the game.

—user summary

In Germany there are many words where even Germans are not sure how to spell them. Especially characters like h, which are not spoken or double/triple characters in sequence make here problems.
This game has 50 of this classic German language traps, as quiz cards with the description of the rules and their origin for clarification.

—user summary

These are the Topside Miniature Naval Warfare Rules accompany our naval miniature sets, and are offered as a basic framework for using and enjoying the miniatures. We tried for the emphasis on playability while giving the player a healthy does of realism.  If you are reading this sentence right now, you are probably reading it on paper or in electronic form, rather than written on stone. So read these rules, take the miniatures for a spin, and adjust the battle table to your liking. Season to taste, as the cookbooks say. And enjoy!

Our system allows for a complete interplay between air, naval and submarine combat without bogging down and killing the fun factor. The movement and combat rules are simple but they do add a level of complexity that will require some critical decision making throughout the game. Our goal was to have you focus on the critical decision tree the rules will present you with - and not fight the rules!

A scenario book covering 17 WWII naval battles is available for pdf download.

Fringo is a guess the word party game, with the usual approach of one team member trying to describe the word to others, but there is one catch: the description needs to be in the form of questions.

If the word was 'Germany', the description could be "What is a big country in the Central Europe? Which country's capital is Berlin?" and so on.

The words are categorized into five classes: around the world, animals and nature, famous people, sports, and history. At the start of the game each team gets a board with squares with category names, which are then filled with tokens of corresponding categories.

Teams then take turns with rotating member as the one who tries to get the team to guess the words of needed categories. They can explain as many words as they manage as long as there is time sand timer. Afterwards the team can flip as many category tokens as they guessed words correctly. First team to flip all of them wins the game.

A solo game where you must successfully harness the energy of the elements to casts spells.

This is a solo roll and write that takes up to 15 minutes to play. Using dice you get values that correspond to markings on a spell sheet that is set in a circle, you connect those points and attempt to trap the element within and make specific patterns with the connecting lines.

—description from the designer

A free print&play dice game for 2-8 players where players compete in 10 different events.

Each of the 10 events will have one or multiple winners, the player who wins the most events will take home the Golden Dicelympics Medal

Luck, dexterity and picking the right opponent are all required to win.

—description from the designer

Slide and steady wins the race!

It’s hot! All the animals of the jungle are meeting at the lake… But Turtle is late, as usual. How can he join his friends as soon as possible? Slide down the river!

With a flick, the players propel the turtle into the lake, then flip over animal tiles to advance on their personal board. Who will be the first to find all their animals?

—description from the publisher

Who said Snow White can't fight?

The heroes of our favorite tales have decided to build a village to live happily! But it was without counting on a dragon quietly settled in the abandoned castle nearby. The dragon has an evil eye for the invaders who are ogling its precious treasures.

One player plays the role of the Dragon while all the others play the heroes. Although the Dragon’s power is absolute, it can only be in one place at a time. Heroes try to plunder the Dragon’s orchard, armory and treasure or build houses in their village while the Dragon furiously tries to stop them. If the Heroes manage to exhaust 2 of the Dragon’s 3 resources or build enough houses before the end of the 10 turns, they win. The Dragon wins if it manages to drive enough Heroes away or prevent them from building enough houses.

—description from the publisher

Capt'n Sharky has been on a great voyage and has found many beautiful things for his friends, which now have to be stowed away as well as possible in the treasure chamber.

Each player gets 21 treasures and 2 wooden planks. Each player first places two wooden planks horizontally or vertically in the opponent's half of the treasure chamber. Then the players each take turns placing one of their treasures in the treasure chamber and try to place as many as possible. The treasures may touch each other, but not lie on top of each other. When placing the treasures, remember that the treasure map and anchor each score two points, and the other treasures each score one point. If no player can place more treasures, the value of the treasures is added and the player with the more valuable collection wins.

—user summary

Chivalheart: Uprising is a card-driven strategy wargame for two players to enjoy over approximately ninety minutes per session with high replayability. It is proudly an “Amerigame”, meaning that the narrative is at the core of the experience. In Chivalheart: Uprising, one player assumes the role of the imperialistic Seren while the other becomes the desperate Rebels with the latter’s homeland providing the battlefield(s). The two factions are highly asymmetrical and feature different strengths: the Rebels have superior numbers and means of maneuvering around the map, while the Seren start with control of all settlements and are fundamentally more dangerous combatants.

—description from the designer

Cake Auf is a take-that, recipe fulfilling card game best for 2-4 people, perfect for families and parties!

In Cake Auf, you play as a chef juggling multiple recipes at once. Each recipe has a star value: 1 star to 3 stars, rated based on difficulty. Finish a recipe and you collect the number of stars on the recipe. The first player to reach 5 stars wins!

In SPECTRE: The Board Game, you take on the role of one of the many iconic villains from the James Bond film franchise, competing with one another to become Number One of the Special Executive for Counter-intelligence, Terrorism, Revenge, and Extortion, a.k.a., SPECTRE.

Are you simply in the game to acquire gold bullion, or are your aspirations more philosophical, safe in the knowledge that the world would be better off with you running it? Each villain has their own plot inspired by films such as Dr. No (1962) and Diamonds Are Forever (1971) driving them along the path to becoming SPECTRE's Number One. No matter how hard you try, though, 007 is always there, waiting to disrupt your plans and reveal your secrets.

SPECTRE: The Board Game features iconic weapons, locations, and characters from the James Bond films. You will be able to assemble devices, spy on your opponents, blackmail your rivals in order to build your own criminal empire, and strategically deploy your agents around the globe to infiltrate key installations. You need to work behind the scenes to develop your nefarious plots and become 007's biggest threat, so grab your Persian cat and call your favorite henchman as you prepare your newest monologue — it's time to get down to business and start building that moon base and world-destroying megalaser!

—description from the publisher

"Ahoy me hearties, have I a story for ye! Years ago I was the high captain of a grand fleet of ships. The world was the helm of me ship, and I had her in the palm of me hand. Then, a warring storm came upon us before we knew it and in a flash me entire fleet was sleeping in the depths of Davy Jones' Locker. As luck would have it, myself and a hand full of me scallawags managed to stay afloat on a raft made from empty rum barrels. For days we were adrift, thirsty, hungry, and scorched by the sun. Of the original crew only myself and three others survived the trial. We were saddened by the loss of our brothers and sisters at sea, yet somehow smiles found us again as we finally stepped upon the shores of an uncharted desert island. The island was just rich enough with fresh water and resources to support the four of us. After years on the island, we missed our old life so much, that we came up with this game to remind us of who we once were. Other than our bones, it is all that remains of a life that once was."

Black Flags is a competitive table-top game which uses a unique rondel system, story telling, dice rolling, and narrative choice to transport players to a fantasy world of piracy, commerce, and nautical adventure.

Players take turns in clockwise fashion until a player takes the last gold coin from the bank. When this occurs, the game immediately ends. The player with the most gold wins the game.

—description from the designer

A game of two teams allowing players to compete in a pub quiz in the comfort of their own home. Categories consist of History, Sport, Music & Film.

—user summary

Players try to give correct definitions to words in order to advance their spaceship back to Earth. Spaces either require a player to pick Intergalactic cards or Earth cards, which require them to either advance on the board or define a word. The first player to have left Earth, visited Granada and returned to Earth (by exact count) is the winner.

—user summary

You shouldn't play with the dishes? Sometimes this is exactly what you must do!

Espresso Doppio contains three espresso cups, saucers, and spoons in three colors, and your goal during the game is to place them and move them on the placemat to match the combinations depicted on your task cards.

To set up, shuffle the deck of 16 task cards and give half to each player, each of whom reveals three cards face up. Players take turns placing items one at a time on the placemat, which has room for five settings on it. You can mix or match colors as you wish, but two of the same item (saucer, cup, spoon) can never be on the same setting. On a turn, you take 1-3 actions, with an action consisting of moving any one item from one setting to another or swapping items on one setting for items on another setting. After your actions, you score coffee beans for whatever task cards you can, with some cards scoring multiple times if the conditions are right.

As soon as a player has scored all eight cards, the players swap their decks of task cards, shuffle them, then reveal three task cards and continue playing. Once a player has scored eight cards in the second round of play, the game ends and whoever has collected the most coffee beans wins.

Senjutsu is a 1-4 Player Samurai Duelling Game with slick Deck Construction mechanics, simultaneous reveal combat and beautiful miniatures from a panel of sculptors.  Control 1 of 4 fearsome Samurai, warriors bound to the Bushido Code, each with their own strengths, weaknesses, and motivations.

Using Senjutsu's Deck Construction Mechanics, forge a unique deck of devastating attacks, powerful blocks, timely mediations, and dynamic special moves. The intuitive card-classifying system makes forging your Samurai’s Ability Deck easy.

The Core Box includes dozens of different Ability Cards to shape your chosen Samurai's fighting style. There are thousands of possible deck combinations available,

Gameplay Summary:


     Position your Samurai on the Battlefield. 
     Draw a hand of Ability Cards from your 40 Card Ability Deck. 
     Choose an Ability Card to use and place it facedown with the opponent's card.
     Reveal the cards simultaneously and check the initiatives. 
     Resolve the card and its effects.


Any Samurai who takes 5 wounds will fall... leaving the vanquisher victorious.

In 2018 we decided to include a waterfowl expansion for Backyard Birds. Originally we planned on adding about 20 different waterfowl species; however, we quickly realized that the expansion could easily be made into its own standalone game. We added an additional 20 species and significantly changed the game mechanics from the original Backyard Birds.

Capture as many wetland territory cards as possible using carefully assembled flocks of waterfowl birds. Territory and waterfowl cards award victory points and the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

On your turn, a player can perform one of six actions, acquruing territory, enabling abilities or events.  If none of these can be done, the decks can be shuffled instead.

The game will end after the last wetland territory is revealed from its supply pile then all players play one more round.
Add up the victory points for your wetlands and the waterfowl on the wetlands. Remember to make any adjustments from event cards. Waterfowl in your game area will not score.

The game contains two different variants: one game for two people and one for 2 to 4 people.

In the 2-player game, each player alternately moves one of his figures. The "villager" may only move one space horizontally or vertically onto an unoccupied space. The "vampire" player is also only allowed to move one square, horizontally and vertically. But he may also hit by jumping, also diagonally. The winner is the player who met his or her victory condition.

The 2 - 4 person variant is a modified Halma with its familiar move and victory options.

Maya is a game collection of three Indian games based on ancient America for 2 to 4 people: Patolli, Quippu, Yucatan.

Patolli is a running game with a peculiar dice mechanism: two players each receive a knotted cord and hide any number of knots in their right hand and cover the rest with the left. Then it is revealed at the same time and the number of visible nodes must be The players "roll the dice" with the knotted cords and then move their figures (semi-precious stones). The player who passed the cross (game board) first wins the game.

Quippu is played with the knots and is a pure puzzle game. 
Yucatan is only played in pairs and only with the semi-precious stones. It is a puzzle game in which one player puts together a combination of three stones from two semi-precious stones and the other player has to guess it.

Union Stockyards is a mid-weight economic euro game with unique features:

     A supply/demand driven market that is central to game play, not a sidebar. 
     Low randomness -- market changes due to player decisions.
     A worker-placement game where your workers may go on strike.
     Extensively-researched historical theme about one of the great industrial wonders of U.S. Gilded Age.


Opening in 1865, the Union Stockyards became Chicago’s largest industry and one of the city’s top tourist attractions with a half million visitors annually in the early 1900’s. From the Civil War through the 1920’s, more meat was processed here than anywhere in the world. During its height, 40,000 mostly immigrant workers labored in “the busiest square mile on earth”, where over one million livestock passed monthly, supplying 80% of all U.S. meat. There were over 2,300 livestock pens and 130 miles of railroad within the “yards”.

You play one the “Big Five” meat packers, developing technologies to use every part of the animal while battling labor unions and manipulating the market to your advantage. Union Stockyards is played over six years (rounds), each beginning with an historical event affecting game conditions or adding an additional action. You select your actions through worker placement; however, if you don’t pay your workers enough, they may go on “strike”. You earn cash based on your profit margins when you slaughter cattle, hogs, or sheep. Your profit margin is your meat value minus the livestock cost. The livestock cost is the same for all players, but your meat values will differ due to your engine-building decisions of constructing buildings, establishing branch houses in eastern cities, and improving your brand reputation. At the end of each year, livestock costs (cattle, hogs, sheep) will be adjusted up or down depending on the demand that you created. Sometimes you may choose to slaughter certain livestock just to manipulate the market in your favor. Whichever packer accumulates the most wealth wins the game.

For sure the most famous battle on the Italian Front during the Great War, and a pivotal event of the war on this front. "Caporetto 1917" is a confrontation between two different ways to make war: infiltration tactics against static defense.

Caporetto 1917 is the third wargame on a battle on the Italian Front, after Strafexpedition, 1916 and Gorizia 1916, using the same system and scale. 
It will have a series rule book, with the 2nd edition rules, usable for both Strafexpedition 1916 and Gorizia 1916, with consolidated errata and a more detailed artillery use. The Specific Rules will cover the game scenario itself, with rules dedicated to this battle and where game turns will be 12 hours long (instead of one day per GT). In the historical campaign game there is no way for the Italians to win; the two players, or teams, will play the Austro-German and Italian right wing, against the Austro-German and Italian left wing. In detail, Krauss and Stein Groups attacking the Italian IV Corps, and Berrer and Scotti Groups attacking the Italian VII Corps and part of the XXVII.

The map will run from Mount Canin and Rombon on the West to Tolmino bridgehead on the East, and from Plezzo and Monte Nero on the North to Cividale and the Friuli plains on the South. It will be divided in sectors where each player, or team, will have to achieve its objectives faster than the opponent.

The campaign game will be big, with 2 maps, and over 1000 units and markers, but short, from October 24th to October 27th, when general Cadorna gave the order of general withdrawal in front of an unrecoverable situation. By that time, after 8 Game Turns, the Austro-German troops should have run across the whole map. Caporetto campaign game is a rush, but also a study of two different approaches to warfare in World War One. In Caporetto 1917 you will find units and specializations from the former two games, beside Stosstruppen, Arditi, gas and mine attacks, and more. Small scenarios will cover specific episodes of this epic confrontation, and an alternative campaign game, with Austro-German and Italian counterparts, where the Italian player can freely deploy its reserves (only), and can test if the battle could have gone better for the Italian colors.

Welcome to the mobile warfare in the Great War.

—description from the publisher

An enchanting story to play with for all those who love magic. With magic wand and 25 gems.

I am kili the witch and present you with the magical and funny game "Kesselfüllen".

Whoever gets kicked out wins!

You just have to get kicked out and you've won!
But it's not always that easy!

The somewhat different game for the whole family, kindergartens and primary schools.
An educationally valuable game.

Relive the adventures of the famous Alfred Jodocus Kwak and his friends with this exciting board game!

Alfred has disappeared. Kra tells us that Alfred fell down the well, but won't reveal where this well is. As Alfred's good friend, you naturally set out to help him and experience all kinds of exciting adventures.

To get Alfred out of the well, you must first have three friendship cards. Will you be the first to find the well and gather three of Alfred's friends around you? Or will Kra snatch a friendship card from you at the last moment...? By gathering friends around you and carrying out the orders well, you will - a deal is a deal - reach the goal the fastest!

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Do you know your way around Cologne? And if not? Never mind! In this game, you can also get ahead by guessing - even if it's only by guessing your fellow players well. Discover the megacity on the Rhine in a playful way!

Cologne offers in 86 'Veedeln'(quarters) much known, but also surprises. However, if you already have a clue, you have good chances to score a lot of points: What is the largest brewery in Cologne? When was the chocolate museum opened? Which neighborhoods have an area code other than 0221? And how many employees does Cologne-Bonn Airport actually have?

One player is the guessing master, and only he has to answer the question posed to him by his challenger. All the other players decide whether they think the answer is right or wrong. But beware! The estimation master can also reject the question. In that case, the challenger must take the guessing stone in his own hand - at a higher risk, of course. Who accepts the challenge?

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Those who already have a clue, however, have a good chance of scoring a lot of points. The player with the most points wins.
First you assemble the tower then catapult cats of various sizes counting points depending on where they land.

Tile-laying game - who can make the longest worm?

The game consists of tiles with sections of different-coloured worms on each tile. Players play tiles to the shared tableau and score points when the tile they add completes a worm. A proper worm must at least have a head and a tail but the longer the worm the more points you get!

—user summary
